title: Constellation Maps
description: Learn how to read sky maps and locate major seasonal constellations.
tldr: Sky maps are time-based snapshots. Match the map to your date and rotate it to align with your horizon.

sections.title: Reading the chart
sections.body: Use the date and time ring on a planisphere to align the map with the sky. Rotate until the horizon matches.

sections.title: Seasonal anchors
sections.body: Start with bright constellations like Orion or Ursa Major. They anchor you when the sky feels unfamiliar.

sections.title: Practice routine
sections.body: Spend five minutes locating two constellations each night. Small wins build confidence.

quiz.question: What does a sky map represent?
quiz.explanation: Maps change with time and date.

quiz.question: Why start with bright constellations?
quiz.explanation: Bright constellations help you orient quickly.

quiz.question: How long should nightly practice be?
quiz.explanation: Short sessions keep the habit consistent.
